_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ATTEBURY GRAIN, INC.
                                                          AMARILLO, TEXAS
                                                            (806)-335-1639

                                           ATTEBURY GRAIN, INC. CLAUDE  (EAST)
FOR FUTHER INFORMATION CONTACT: MIKE L. CAMPBELL, PLANT MANAGER   (806)-226-2251

                                   RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN - EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

     ATTEBURY GRAIN, INC.  AND ITS EMPLOYEES ARE COMMITTED TO SAFETY AND THE PREVENTION 
OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA (NH3). NEW EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED BY 
AN EXPERIENCED EMPLOYEE IN THE AREA OF THEIR JOB DISCRIPTION. THE NEW EMPLOYEE WILL BE
EXPECTED TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH OUR SAFETY POLICIES AND PROCEDURES THROUGH ON
THE JOB TRAINING OR WRITTEN POLICIES.

     ATTEBURY, CLAUDE (EAST)  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY IS NH3 RECEIVING, STORAGE, AND DISTRIBUTION FOR SALE TO FARMERS. WE PROVIDE EMPLOYEES WITH RUBBER GLOVES, GOGGLES,
AND RUBBER SUITS FOR THEIR SAFETY WHILE HANDLING NH3. TWO WAY RADIOS ARE USED TO KEEP
MANAGEMENT INFORMED WHILE NURSE TANKS ARE BEING FILLED. ONE EMPLOYEE IS ON THE CLAUDE
VOL. FIRE DEPARTMENT, SO WE COULD HAVE AN EMERGENCY TEAM ON SITE IN A SHORT TIME. 
SAFETY AND MAINTANCE ARE ALWAYS STRESSED TO KEEP ACCIDENTS TO A MINIMUN, WE HAVE HAD NO ACCIDENTS IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

      OUR FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERENGY PLAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29.CFR 1910.38,  PROVIDED  LOCAL AUTHORITIES WITH THE EMERGENCY PLAN AND EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED BY SARA TITLE III.  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE USED TO ASSESS THE MAITENANCE OF SAFE CONDTIONS. THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SAFETY IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME. 

      THE MAXIMUN QUANITY STORED AT THIS FACILITY IN TWO 12,000 GAL TANKS IS 104,000 LBS, THESE TANKS ARE NOT CONNECTED BY ANY MEANS.  WE ONLY RECIEV

E NH3 BY TRUCK TRANSPORT AT 45,000 LBS PER LOAD. INVENTORIES ARE KEPT AT A MINIMUN TO KEEP ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE TO A MINIMUN.

     THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF THE TOTAL CONTENTS OF ONE TANK 54,000 LBS RELEASED  IN TEN MINUTES WITH AN ENDPOINT DISTANCE OF 0.72 MILES.

     THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO BASE ON POTENTIAL INCIDENT OF BREAKING A TRANSFER HOSE IS 7,172 LBS RELEASED IN TWO MINUTES WITH AN ENDPOINT DISTANCE OF .33 MILES.
